name: The Knock-off of Bongo Jr
description:
This tale starts with the introduction of Cream Land, an okay looking kingdom full of average people. The only person who wasn’t average was the king. That was until he was mysteriously murdered one night while sleeping in the grand hall of his castle. Bongo the knight and his son Bongo jr. traveled to the castle to meet the Princess Zorgo. She had summoned them to find out who had murdered the king.

At their meeting, a large, pig-like creature appeared out of thin air. The creature told Princess Zorgo that he had done the murder and that his name was Gaspan. After that Gaspan grabbed Zorgo. Bongo tried to defend the princess, but Gaspan just chopped his head off. Bongo jr. ran over to help his dying father. With an evil laugh, Gaspan disappeared with Zorgo and so the heir to the throne was lost.

Bongo looked at his son, and stuttered these words, “Bongo Junior, you must save Princess Zorgo. The kingdom depends on it!” He began to say something else, but Bongo’s head died. Bongo jr. stood and wiped a tear from his face. He returned to his father’s house and began to stress eat, getting very fat.

Meanwhile, Cream Land began to fall into ruin. People couldn’t go through their day without running into one of Gaspan’s minions. One day, an old man came to Bongo’s house. “Bongo jr. are you in there?” says the man. Bongo jr. opens the door and swallows a macaron. “You must meet me near the foot of Dung Mountain.” continues the old man, “There I will give you something that will help you survive Gaspan’s minions and find Zorgo. Next, the old man leaves. Bongo jr. stares at him as he leaves.

The next day, Bongo jr. decides to go to the foot of Dung Mountain to find the old man and save Zorgo.
